net.opentsdb.tsd

Class AbstractHttpQuery

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.opentsdb.tsd.AbstractHttpQuery
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    HttpRpcPluginQuery

    public abstract class AbstractHttpQuery
extends Object
    Abstract base class for HTTP queries.
    Since:
    2.2

      • getRemoteAddress

        public String getRemoteAddress()
        Returns:
        The remote address and port in the format <ip>:<port>

      • getPrintableHeaders

        public Map<String,String> getPrintableHeaders()
        Copies the header list and obfuscates the "cookie" header in case it contains auth tokens, etc. Note that it flattens duplicate headers keys as comma separated lists per the RFC
        Returns:
        The full set of headers for this query with the cookie obfuscated

      • getHeaders

        public Map<String,String> getHeaders()
        Copies the header list so modifications won't affect the original set. Note that it flattens duplicate headers keys as comma separated lists per the RFC
        Returns:
        The full set of headers for this query

      • getHeaderValue

        public String getHeaderValue(String headerName)
        Return the value of the given HTTP Header first match wins
        Returns:
        Header value as string

        public int processingTimeMillis()
        Returns how many ms have elapsed since this query was created.

      • getQueryString

        public Map<String,List<String>> getQueryString()
        Returns the query string parameters passed in the URI.

      • getQueryStringParam

        public String getQueryStringParam(String paramname)
        Returns the value of the given query string parameter.

        If this parameter occurs multiple times in the URL, only the last value is returned and others are silently ignored.

        Parameters:
        paramname - Name of the query string parameter to get.
        Returns:
        The value of the parameter or null if this parameter wasn't passed in the URI.

      • getRequiredQueryStringParam

        public String getRequiredQueryStringParam(String paramname)
                                   throws BadRequestException
        Returns the non-empty value of the given required query string parameter.

        If this parameter occurs multiple times in the URL, only the last value is returned and others are silently ignored.

        Parameters:
        paramname - Name of the query string parameter to get.
        Returns:
        The value of the parameter.
        Throws:
        BadRequestException - if this query string parameter wasn't passed or if its last occurrence had an empty value (&amp;a=).

      • hasQueryStringParam

        public boolean hasQueryStringParam(String paramname)
        Returns whether or not the given query string parameter was passed.
        Parameters:
        paramname - Name of the query string parameter to get.
        Returns:
        true if the parameter

      • getQueryStringParams

        public List<String> getQueryStringParams(String paramname)
        Returns all the values of the given query string parameter.

        In case this parameter occurs multiple times in the URL, this method is useful to get all the values.

        Parameters:
        paramname - Name of the query string parameter to get.
        Returns:
        The values of the parameter or null if this parameter wasn't passed in the URI.

      • getQueryPath

        public String getQueryPath()
        Returns only the path component of the URI as a string This call strips the protocol, host, port and query string parameters leaving only the path e.g. "/path/starts/here"

        Note that for slightly quicker performance you can call request().getUri() to get the full path as a string but you'll have to strip query string parameters manually.

        Returns:
        The path component of the URI
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if the URI is null

      • explodePath

        public String[] explodePath()
        Returns the path component of the URI as an array of strings, split on the forward slash Similar to the getQueryPath() call, this returns only the path without the protocol, host, port or query string params. E.g. "/path/starts/here" will return an array of {"path", "starts", "here"}

        Note that for maximum speed you may want to parse the query path manually.

        Returns:
        An array with 1 or more components, note the first item may be an empty string.
        Throws:
        BadRequestException - if the URI is empty or does not start with a slash
        NullPointerException - if the URI is null

      • getQueryBaseRoute

        public abstract String getQueryBaseRoute()
        Parses the query string to determine the base route for handing a query off to an RPC handler.
        Returns:
        the base route
        Throws:
        BadRequestException - if some necessary part of the query cannot be parsed.

      • getCharset

        public Charset getCharset()
        Attempts to parse the character set from the request header. If not set defaults to UTF-8
        Returns:
        A Charset object
        Throws:
        UnsupportedCharsetException - if the parsed character set is invalid

      • hasContent

        public boolean hasContent()
        Returns:
        True if the request has content, false if not.

      • getContent

        public String getContent()
        Decodes the request content to a string using the appropriate character set
        Returns:
        Decoded content or an empty string if the request did not include content
        Throws:
        UnsupportedCharsetException - if the parsed character set is invalid

      • done

        public void done()
        Method to call after writing the HTTP response to the wire. The default is to simply log the request info. Can be overridden by subclasses.

      • internalError

        public void internalError(Exception cause)
        Sends 500/Internal Server Error to the client.
        Parameters:
        cause - The unexpected exception that caused this error.

      • badRequest

        public void badRequest(BadRequestException exception)
        Sends 400/Bad Request status to the client.
        Parameters:
        exception - The exception that was thrown

      • notFound

        public void notFound()
        Sends 404/Not Found to the client.

      • sendStatusOnly

        public void sendStatusOnly(org.jboss.netty.handler.codec.http.HttpResponseStatus status)
        Send just the status code without a body, used for 204 or 304
        Parameters:
        status - The response code to reply with

      • sendBuffer

        public void sendBuffer(org.jboss.netty.handler.codec.http.HttpResponseStatus status,
                       org.jboss.netty.buffer.ChannelBuffer buf,
                       String contentType)
        Sends an HTTP reply to the client.
        Parameters:
        status - The status of the request (e.g. 200 OK or 404 Not Found).
        buf - The content of the reply to send.
